nodes.text: Borra Setas was a female Rodian who lived in the town of Anchorhead on Tatooine during the time of the Galactic Civil War.
During 1.5 ABY, female Rodian Borra Setas resided in the town of Anchorhead on Tatooine.

During this time, a female Twi'lek entertainer named Anetia Kah'ryn tasked a novice entertainer with gathering information from Crix Yarrow, Dorn Gestros, and Borra Setas concerning criminal activity in Mos Eisley. When the entertainer traveled to Anchorhead and approached Borra Setas, she said it would probably be best not to talk to her. The entertainer asked why, and mentioned that Borra looked sad. Borra then lashed back that she was not sad, but rather scared due to the position she was in. When the entertainer said it could not be that bad, Borra yelled that the entertainer was not the one who upset a major crime boss, later revealed to be Jabba Desilijic Tiure. The entertainer asked Borra for more information, at which point she grew dismayed at saying too much already. Feel as though her life was already at stake, she decided to may as well divulge more information. She informed the spacer that she discovered a major crime figure was putting political pressure on someone in Mos Eisley. However, she refused to reveal anymore information. Afterwards, the entertainer returned to Anetia Kah'ryn to bring back this information, and await further instructions.

Borra Setas was a Non-Player Character (NPC) in the MMORPG Star Wars Galaxies. Players of the entertainer profession could perform a quests for Anetia Kah'ryn in Mos Eisley titled The Entertainer's Life. Several parts of this quest involved having the entertainer player speak to three different people to gain information about a possible criminal takeover plot of Mos Eisley. These people included Crix Yarrow, Dorn Gestros, and Borra Setas. Once the player spoke to Borra, she revealed that a major crime figure was putting political pressure on someone in Mos Eisley. This crime figure was later identified as Jabba Desilijic Tiure, as the player continued the quests for Anetia. These entertainer-specific quests were removed from the game during the New Game Enhancements of November 15, 2005. Although the player could choose not to do Anetia Kah'ryn's quests, this article assumes 100% game completion.
